result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Tewelis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 5 days. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
No contact with any known illegal drug user with the exception in AODA programming.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
No contact with Ethan W. (DOB08-30-1991).
No contact with Megan C. (DOB 09-21-1992).
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for first year of probation. 
Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.

timeConds.notes: without good time credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use if defendant has a positive drug or alcohol test.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1 -

Court ordered defendant to serve 320 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 5 days. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for first year of probation. 
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.  
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user with the exception in AODA programming.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Ethan W. (DOB08-30-1991).
- No contact with Megan C. (DOB 09-21-1992).
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 120 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use if defendant has a positive drug or alcohol test.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Thomas J Tewelis in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Thomas J Tewelis in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

 AS TO COUNT  1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Thomas J Tewelis not in court, in custody, not procuded.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Case set for plea and sentencing. Defense request an adjournment due to another pending matter. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Thomas J Tewelis not in court, in custody, not produced.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Held off the record. Discovery received, case adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas J Tewelis in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Thomas J Tewelis in custody.  Nick Cerwin for Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms, ammunition, firearm holster, magazine or body armor. 
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Thomas J Tewelis not in court, in custody.  Danielle Choknacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for return on warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets cash bail. Case is adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
Justice Point Discharge Summary dated April 13, 2015, received and filed.
Bench Warrant served. Original in Court file.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/3/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Thomas J Tewelis in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Thomas J Tewelis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
